sub_title: Human Rights Law Specialist | Expertise in legal and policy research
summary:
I am a Human Rights Law Specialist with 10+ years of consulting and professional experience managing and participating in numerous projects, programs and initiatives for international organizations and NGOs in Tajikistan, Europe, and Central Asia (UNICEF, OSCE, IOM, DCA&ICCO, UNDP, UN Women, OSI, ICNL, ACLED, Minority Rights Group).

I have a deep interest and knowledge of Human Rights issues in political, civil, and economic spheres with a focus on access to justice and the rule of law, women's rights, gender equality, prevention of sexual and gender-based violence, children’s rights, migrant workers' rights, and prevention of forced labor and human trafficking.

My core competencies include:

🟢	Human Rights 
🟢	Migrant Rights & Refugee Rights
🟢	Gender Equality
🟢 Access to Justice and Rule of Law 
🟢	International Human Rights Advocacy (UN Treaty Bodies, UPR System)
🟢	Human Rights Policies & Procedures
🟢	International Labour Law & Labour Standards
🟢	Prevention of Forced Labour & Trafficking in Human Beings 
🟢Business and Human Rights 
🟢	Child & Women’s Rights
🟢	Legal Research & Analysis
🟢	Reporting 

I am passionate about research, and  my research work mainly focuses on Central Asia and post -soviet Region.

profile_positions.description:
•	Under the overall supervision of the IOM project leads and in close coordination with the staff of the Tajik State Agency "Centers for consultation and pre-departure preparation of labour migrants" in Dushanbe (PDO Centre) provide an accurate, detailed and migrant-centric legal review of the contracts between PDO Centre and Pro-Force LTD (a UK based Operator of SWP) and with migrant workers.

profile_positions.title: Legal expert on safe migration and the SWP route to the UK
Consultant for conducting monitoring of Tajik migrants’ rights and needs
Migration Consultant

profile_positions.description:
Job description:
• Provide expertise regarding international labor migration patterns, legal framework, and barriers to female migrant workers in Kiribati under the “Due Diligence Support for Activities to Strengthen Women’s Economic Empowerment in MCC Compact and Threshold Countries” Project.
• Conduct a case study on financial literacy and financial inclusion for international labor migrants and their families.

Deliverables: 
• Conducted case study on best practices on financial inclusion and financial literacy of migrant workers in Asia (Philippines, India, Indonesia) and the Pacific (Fiji, Vanuatu, Kiribati). The report provided a review of national programs and legislation concerning financial literacy and financial inclusion of migrants, described practices of development projects and financial institutions' initiatives, and an overview of the basic principles of financial literacy of migrants, including the gender aspect in the financial inclusion and literacy of women engaged in international migration.
profile_positions.title: Migration Consultant

profile_positions.description:
Job description: 
• Develop methodology and tools for the research and identify countries for the case study in Asia, the Americas, Europe, and Africa.
• Analyze the definition of ‘diaspora’ and its legal framework across the globe.
• Analyze promising practices in diaspora engagement policies and specific political and socio- economic rights in the selected countries.
• Deliver a presentation of the research methodology at the Global Diaspora Summit 2022.
• Submit a full report and incorporate review comments and inputs for the publication.

Deliverables: 
A report with promising practices in countries of origin of migrants (Ghana, Mexico, India, Portugal) and
countries of destination of migrants (Germany and Colombia) prepared. The report included information on diaspora engagement, the development of policies and legislation, the reflection of gender issues and the inclusion of transnational identity in legislation. The definition of ‘diaspora’ at the international and regional level was reviewed, including its evolution. The definition of ‘diaspora’ at the national level was reviewed, covering 22 countries.
profile_positions.title: Consultant - Diaspora Engagement: Transnational Identity & Rights

profile_positions.description:
Job description: 
• Develop methodology and tools for the research to assess the legal needs of vulnerable and marginalized population.
• Conduct desk research and fieldwork (key informant interviews and focus group discussions) to map the legal needs of vulnerable and marginalized groups of people (migrants, people with disabilities, women in an unfavorable situation).
• Prepare a report with recommendations for ICNL's USAID-funded Civil Society Support Program in Tajikistan.

Deliverables: 
•Assistance was provided in selecting the most vulnerable category of the population (women in disadvantaged situations, migrant workers, and people with disabilities) for the ICNL Legal Support Program (LSP). An analysis of the legislation was carried out to determine what guarantees were provided to these vulnerable groups. Based on a review of secondary information, interviews, and focus group discussions, the main barriers to rights and their implementation are identified. 
•Mapping of CSOs was conducted. 
•Based on the analysis and recommendations, LSP developed its training program for CSOs in Tajikistan.
profile_positions.title: Consultant to Assess Legal Needs of Vulnerable and Marginalized Citizens in Tajikistan

profile_positions.description:
National Consultant for Spotlight Initiative Tajikistan (remote and on-site) - UNDP, UN Women, and UNICEF funded project to contribute to the elimination of sexual and gender-based violence (SGBV)
•	Provide consultancy on the Justice component (legislation and policies within criminal, civil, and family law)
•	Conduct the analysis to assess the law policy and practice in accessing women and girls to education, health, labour market, security, and access to justice, and provide recommendations for improvement
•	Perform stakeholder analysis (Judges, Prosecutors, Police, Lawyers, NGOs)
•	Conduct consultations and interviews with: 
o	Stakeholders – assess the implementation of the law, identify main barriers, and collect recommendations for a legislation change
o	Target groups - collect information about the main human rights violations

Key achievements:
•	Done a comprehensive analysis of the law and policies in the justice sector of Tajikistan on how the rights of SGBV are guaranteed in this sector, how they are (not) protected by law, or how their needs are (not) taken into account during the investigation and court trial procedures
profile_positions.title: National Consultant

•	Evaluated their willingness to work under the Winrock Kazakhstan on Safe Migration Project
•	Wrote the Assessment and Final Reports and developed the Concept Note
•	Conducted the exit validation meeting with Diasporas and CSOs to discuss research findings and the Concept Note
